oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Galileons as the Scalar Analogue of General Relativity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Klein, Remko
Ozkan, Mehmet
Roest, Diederik
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Theory
Astrophysics - Cosmology and Nongalactic Astrophysics
General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We establish a correspondence between general relativity with diffeomorphism invariance and scalar field theories with Galilean invariance: notions such as the Levi-Civita connection and the Riemann tensor have a Galilean counterpart. This suggests Galilean theories as the unique nontrivial alternative to gauge theories (including general relativity). Moreover, it is shown that the requirement of first-order Palatini formalism uniquely determines the Galileon models with second-order field equations, similar to the Lovelock gravity theories. Possible extensions are discussed.
